cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn northeast, brushing the North Carolina Outer Banks Monday, then accelerating northeast and curving well offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast toward the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the Outer Banks of North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch/Warning only posted for Surf City to Duck NC; none north of there
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Surf City to Duck NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Swells and fringe tropical-storm conditions possible along the U.S. southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts from Florida to New Jersey
weather_observation.wind: Gusty east to northeast winds Monday night-Tuesday, generally 25–35 mph inland with occasional higher gusts along the Jersey shore; tropical-storm-force sustained winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (less than 2 ft) possible at times of high tide due to long-period swells
weather_observation.rainfall: Brief periods of rain, generally 0.5–1.5 inches with isolated 2 inch totals
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas that may disrupt pilot transfers and lightering operations in Delaware Bay and approaches to Camden/Philadelphia
